target_text: The video shows a man lifting a heavy box from a conveyor belt in a workshop. His upper arm is raised moderately above shoulder level, placing increased strain on the shoulder joint. Meanwhile, his neck is strongly flexed, causing significant muscular load. His trunk is also severely bent forward, posing a high risk of lower back strain.

A woman is seen assembling machine parts. Her upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, suggesting overhead work and a high shoulder load. Additionally, her trunk is bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees, which increases spinal loading and strain.

The footage captures a man fixing an industrial panel. His upper arm is far above shoulder level, indicating overhead work and high shoulder load, and it is also abducted, which can lead to rotator cuff stress and joint instability. His lower arm appears too extended or overly flexed, risking fatigue if maintained. Meanwhile, his trunk is tilted sideways, contributing to muscle imbalance and fatigue.
The scene shows a female worker leaning over a production line. Her upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, which places a high load on the shoulder and suggests overhead work.

This clip depicts a man standing on a step ladder. His trunk is severely bent forward, posing a significant risk of lower back strain. Additionally, his upper arm is abducted, indicating stress on the rotator cuff and potential joint instability.

A woman is kneeling beside a rolling cart while working. Her upper arm is moderately above shoulder level, increasing strain on the shoulder joint, and it is also abducted, further stressing the rotator cuff. Her trunk is severely bent forward and rotated, raising the torsional load on her spine and increasing the risk of lower back injuries.

The footage shows a male worker pulling a lever. His neck is side-bent, which may cause muscle imbalance and fatigue. Additionally, his trunk is severely bent forward, exposing him to a high risk of lower back strain, and he is standing on one leg, leading to asymmetric loading on the lower body.

This scene captures a woman pushing a cart across the factory floor. Her upper arm is moderately elevated above shoulder level, which increases shoulder strain. Her lower arm appears either too extended or overly flexed, potentially leading to fatigue. Furthermore, her trunk is bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees, resulting in increased spinal loading.

The video shows a man tightening screws on a metallic sheet using a handheld drill. His trunk is severely bent forward, posing a high risk of lower back strain. At the same time, his neck is strongly flexed, adding significant muscular load on the cervical spine.

In this clip, a woman stretches forward to inspect a malfunctioning control panel. Her upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, exposing her shoulder to a high load due to overhead work. Additionally, her lower arm is either too extended or overly flexed, which could cause muscular fatigue. Her trunk is tilted sideways, leading to muscle imbalance and additional strain.
While examining a circuit board, the technician's trunk is tilted sideways, which may cause muscle imbalance and fatigue. Additionally, his neck is extended, increasing stress on the cervical spine.

As the woman reaches sideways to grab a part from a neighboring assembly bin, her legs bear an asymmetric load by standing on one leg. Her neck is strongly flexed, placing significant muscular strain, and her upper arm is moderately elevated above shoulder level and abducted, stressing both the shoulder joint and the rotator cuff.

The video shows a man turning knobs on a large machine. His upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, suggesting overhead work and high shoulder loading. His lower arm appears too extended or overly flexed, which could lead to fatigue if sustained.

The footage captures a female worker bending sideways to grab a dropped tool. Her trunk is rotated, increasing the torsional load on her spine, while her neck is both extended and side-bent, compounding cervical stress and muscle imbalance.

While using a wrench, the man’s trunk is severely bent forward and tilted sideways, exposing him to significant lower back strain and muscle imbalance. Meanwhile, his upper arm is moderately raised above shoulder level, increasing strain on the shoulder joint.

Seated with one arm resting on the table, the woman’s trunk is severely bent forward and tilted sideways, adding spinal load and imbalance. Her upper arm is far above shoulder level, indicating overhead exertion and a high shoulder load.

As the man pulls a hose toward a hydraulic system, his neck is extended, placing increased stress on the cervical spine. Additionally, he is standing on one leg, creating an asymmetric load on his lower body.
Placing an item behind her on a shelf, the woman’s trunk is tilted sideways, which can cause muscular imbalance and fatigue. Her neck is extended as well, leading to added cervical spine stress.

Leaning into a large tank, the male employee's trunk is rotated, increasing the torsional load on his spine. At the same time, his neck is strongly flexed, placing significant muscular strain on the cervical area.

Surrounded by boxes, the woman is standing with her trunk bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees, rotated, and tilted sideways — a posture that places her spine under considerable torsional and muscular stress. Meanwhile, her upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, exposing the shoulder to high load due to overhead work.

Sitting on a rolling stool, the man’s trunk is bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees and tilted sideways, stressing the lower back and causing muscle imbalance. Additionally, he is standing on one leg, leading to asymmetric loading on the lower body.

While bending her knees to lift a box, the woman’s trunk is rotated, increasing torsional strain on the spine. Her neck is strongly flexed, adding significant muscular load, and her upper arm is abducted, stressing the rotator cuff.
The scene captures a man adjusting overhead wires. His trunk is rotated, increasing torsional stress on the spine, and his neck is extended, putting additional strain on the cervical region.

Stacking boxes onto a high shelf, the female employee's upper arm is moderately elevated above shoulder level, raising strain on the shoulder. At the same time, her trunk is severely bent forward, exposing her lower back to a high risk of strain.

Dragging a large bin across a cluttered work zone, the man’s lower arm is either too extended or overly flexed, which could cause fatigue if sustained. His upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, exposing it to a high load, and his neck is strongly flexed, adding significant muscular stress.
Holding a clipboard in one hand, the woman’s neck is extended and side-bent, which places stress on the cervical spine and may cause muscle imbalance and fatigue.
As the man walks, his trunk is rotated, adding torsional stress to the spine, and he places asymmetric load on his lower body by standing on one leg.

While seated and working at a computer, the woman’s trunk is bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees and rotated, increasing both spinal loading and torsional strain. She also stands on one leg, creating an asymmetric load on the lower body.

Lifting a panel using both hands, the man’s trunk is severely bent forward, exposing his lower back to a high risk of strain. His upper arm is abducted, which stresses the rotator cuff and may cause joint instability.

Kneeling to reach a part of a car, the man’s trunk is bent forward between 20 to 60 degrees and rotated, which raises both spinal loading and torsional strain.

While seated at an office desk, the woman’s trunk is tilted sideways, causing muscle imbalance. Her neck is also side-bent, further adding to muscular asymmetry. Additionally, her lower arm is either too extended or overly flexed, risking fatigue, while her upper arm is raised far above shoulder level, indicating overhead strain.

As the male employee picks up boxes, he stands on one leg, creating an asymmetric load on the lower body. His neck is side-bent, leading to muscle imbalance, and his upper arm is abducted, stressing the rotator cuff.
